forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 50. Southwest wind around 7 mph.

forecast.name: Saturday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 66, with temperatures falling to around 64 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 5 to 21 mph, with gusts as high as 26 mph.

weather_report:
In the quiet embrace of early morning, Downtown San Francisco rests beneath a muted blanket of clouds, the promise of warmth still lingering just out of reach. The air hovers around a cool 50 degrees, caressed by a gentle southwest breeze, hinting at the brighter hours to come. As the sun prepares to rise, the layers of cloud part ever so slightly, paving the way for a Saturday that reveals itself with the kind of clear intention San Franciscans cherish. Set your sights on the day ahead, where predominantly sunny skies are expected, the temperature gradually climbing towards a more agreeable 66, before settling back into the comfort of the afternoon as the sea breeze begins to whisper through the streets.

While there may be no oppressive fog shrouding the city today, remnants of the marine layer linger near the coast, framing the iconic vistas of the Golden Gate. The undulating hills stand proudly against a backdrop of blue, inviting an array of activities—perhaps a leisurely stroll through Golden Gate Park or an impromptu gathering at a local café, where the warmth of a cup and the laughter of friends encapsulate the spirit of the day. Dress in layers; a light sweater or a long-sleeve shirt is perfect, allowing freedom to adapt as the sun asserts itself. Remember, there’s something beautiful about indulging in the simple joys of a clear, sunny Saturday in the city.
